```{r setup}
#install.packages("vioplot")
library("vioplot")
```

# Base function

There are several arguments for vioplot. Please run ?vioplot for more details.

In this script we will be going over these key arguments.

vioplot(x, xlab= ,ylab= ,main=, color= )


# Create Violin Plot 

The data we are using is iris.

```{r}
head(iris)
```


Here we use vioplot to make a violin plot that compares Petal.Length to each Species.


```{r}
vioplot(iris$Petal.Length ~ iris$Species)
```

# Labeling the graph

```{r}
vioplot(iris$Petal.Length ~ iris$Species, 
        xlab= "Species", 
        ylab= "Petal Length",
        main= "Petal Length of Different Species")
```

# Color each violin 

This shows us all the color names we can select in R

```{r}
colors()
```

Make a list of the desired colors

```{r}
color <- c("darkviolet", "cyan", "plum")
```

Add the color to the vioplot in col=

```{r}

vioplot( iris$Petal.Length ~ iris$Species, 
         xlab="Species", 
         ylab= "Petal Length", 
         col= color, 
         main= "Petal Length of Different Species")
```

# Add Jittered Data

Use stripchart to add a set of jittered data

```{r}
vioplot( iris$Petal.Length ~ iris$Species, 
         xlab="Species", 
         ylab= "Petal Length", 
         col= color,
         main= "Petal Length of Different Species")

stripchart(iris$Petal.Length ~ iris$Species, method = "jitter", col = "yellow", vertical = TRUE, pch = 19, add = TRUE)
```
